choices: Professor Dumbledore comes for a visit.
1.content:
"How's our little patient today?" said the nurse with the big witchlike nose. "I see that you didn't drink all of your memory restoring potion, Mr. Lockhart don't you want to get back to your wonderful life and friends? Speaking of friends, are you ready for some visitors?"

Gilderoy Lockhart, no longer the suave and debonair professor of the Dark Arts but he still was in possesion of his award winning smile and model-like good looks, just sat in his floating arm chair and stared out into the hallway of St. Mungos.
1.title: The Nurse

11.content:
"Yes Headmaster Dumbledore, you may see Mr. Lockheart" said the nurse as she stamped away.

Just then, a tall man with flowing robes and half-moon spectacles glides into the room. Lockheart especially liked his beard; it reminded him of the little happy sheep that infested his dreams nowadays.

Lockheart tipped his head sideways, his smile hanging indolently out of the corner of his mouth. "Hmmm, do I recognize you from somewhere?" Lockheart said.

Albus Dumbledore walked to Lockheart's bedide and pulled up a chair. He kept his expression stony and silent.

"Gilderoy, do you now see what happens if you relied too much on your specialized art to gain false advantage?" he said testily. Lockheart made a strange undulating noise.

"Obviously not" he answered for him. Lockheart twisted his neck in a complete circle, before dropping it straight toward the bedhseets. He rolled his eyes upward and opened his mouth, a droplet of saliva falling from it's left corner.

"Obviously what?" he sputtered, throwing his arms around.

Dumbledore adjusted his eye glasses and tilted Lockheart's chin upwards so as to meet the Headmaster's gaze.

"Even if you do not truly hear me Gilderoy, I have come bearing the news that you are now incapable of teaching Defense Against the Dark Arts and you are terminated from your job." Dumbledore said with a low voice.

Lockheart felt something in his head freeze. Even though he had no idea what that strange old man had said, he sure didn't like that sad feeling those words created.

"Job?" Lockheart sputtered.

DUmbledore nodded, "Yes, I shall have to start looking for a replacement" he finished.

Just then, there were strange footsteps that came down the hall. Lockheart turned his head unnaturally fast and saw...
11.title: You're fired!!

choices: They run into another student at St. Mungo's
13.content:
Hermione was the first one to stand in the middle of the doorway and lay her eyes upon her former teacher. Gilderoy still had the same appearance from his teaching and novelist days that she was able to recognize him. Hermione was lost between her feelings wanting to run upto Lockhart and give him a hug and the loyalty to her friends.

This brief encounter was the first time that Hermione had saw Gilderoy since she was restored back from being petrified by the basilisk.

Harry was the second to appear in the doorway. Although Harry was there the day that Gilderoy lost his memory and knew the circumstances surrounding why they were placed in the depths of the Secret Chamber, Harry still felt a little sad for his fallen teacher. He had spent some time wondering, worrying about who'd replace Professor Lockhart as the Dark Arts teacher.

The red-headed second to youngest Weasley crowded into the door frame with his broken wand in his right hand. Ron feared that Gilderoy would recognize him and try for retribution, until Ron got a good look at this professor.

Gilderoy had a blank stare in his eyes but still continued to flash his award winning smile. His blonde hair was not as neat as his former students remembered. His clothes were more wrinkled then any one could remember.

With all of the things that Gilderoy lied to them about, the three; Hermione, Harry and Ron felt a twinge of guilt that their teacher was in St. Mungo's.
13.title: First Vision

132.content:
Nurse Waldowliley entered the room

"Children? You're not bothering our famous Mr. Gilderoy are you?"

"Ah, no mame. We wanted just to help him," Ron said. "He was our teacher at Hogwarts."

She fluffed up the professor's pillows and gave him a little kiss on the cheek. Then, looking at Harry she gasped and put her hands to her lips. "You're that Potter fellow aren't you?"

"Yes," answered Harry lowering his eyes. "Has the Professor shown any improvement at all?"

"No, none. And from what I've heard, you were the cause of this malady. have you no shame! This was a good and handsome man. And now he has been reduced to this."
132.title: Nurse Waldowliley

choices: Will they go,  get the invisibility cloak and sneak in at night?
1322.content:
"Well you see, Ma'am, it was all an accident." Ron started, "We never meant for this to happen!"

"Well I still think you have some nerve coming here. Did you want to gloat over your handiwork?" The nurse stroked Gilderoy's lovely locks and smiled down at him. "This poor man has been through enough. I think you should leave!"

"But we only want to help!" Harry protested.

"You have done quite enough. Leave now, or do I have to call the attendants to have you removed? and report the Headmaster that you came here to further torment this poor, gallant man?

"C'mon, Harry. We don't want to get in trouble." Hermione tugged at his arm. "Besides," she hissed as they left the room, "we can always come back later tonight with the cloak of invisibility."

As they were heading through the maze of corridors leading to the entrance of Saint Mungo's, Ron looked up and his eyes widened. "Harry! Isn't that Snape? Wonder what he is doing here?"

The three ducked into an empty room and peeked through the crack in the door as Snape stalked down the hall in the direction of Gilderoy's room, black robes billowing. He carried a small velvet bag in his hands.

Hermione sniffed and wrinkled her nose as he passed. "He smells like old memberall juice."

"I think we should follow him." Harry looked at the other two. "Maybe he is going to hurt Gilderory. I don't trust him."
1322.title: Potions and Plots

choices: Three young wizards continue their conversation
133.content:
“Hagrid” exclaimed Harry Potter, “what are you doing here?”

“Hi Harry, Ron and Hermione, are you enjoying your summer?”

The three teenage wizards keep the questioning look on their faces which in turn makes Hagrid very uneasy, as a man who has a secret he can’t reveal but knows he’s been caught with it written on his face.

“There’s no putting anything over on you three. Last week I was pulling flesh eating slugs off of my cabbages. Those creatures, fascinating little buggers until they smell you, then they hunt you down like an insulted hippogriff” answered Hagrid, “there is only two ways to get rid of them and since Hogwarts forbids me to use magic I had to get a little creative. Enough of that”

Hermione and Harry weren’t buying into his explanation, since Hermione did some of her light reading of “Magical Insects: Cursed Crawlers to Zigzagging Zephyrs volume 4”.

“Hagrid” Harry and Hermione shouted in unison.

“Well anyways Professor Dumbledore wanted me to check on Professor Lockhart to see if they’ve returned any of his memory. Dumbledore thinks that Lockhart might hold a key to something back at the school...

“I shouldn’t have told you that. When am I going to learn to keep my mouth shut especially around you three?”

Gilderoy Lockhart sits up in his bed, flashes his pearly white teeth, and runs his fingers through his hair before pointing at all four of his guests. “Who are you… you… you… and who are you big fellow?” His mind is shot since that night in the passageway leading to the Chamber of Secrets. Ron Weasley’s broken wand and Lockhart’s single-word spell “Obliterate” left the old Protection from the Dark Arts professor with an IQ lower than the average cucumber.

No one answers the five time winner of Witch Weekly’s Most Charming Smile award. Gilderoy goes back to combing his hair with his fingers. Hagrid squirms out of divulging any more secret Hogwart’s business by saying good-bye to his young friends and students.

“I wonder,” started Ron, “what secret ol’ professor Lockhart can actually have?
133.title: I shouldn't have told you that

15.content:
Gilderoy was seemingly incoherent, but he thought if he could just somehow cure himself of his mental state he'd be well again. Surely, he knew that if he were to be cured it would not be from his own hands.

He wasn't able to speak when Herimone, Harry, and Ron came to visit him. Feeling a deep concern for Gilderoy, Ron took it upon himself to cast a spell in hopes of curing Gilderoy's vegetative mind.

His pubescent voice mumbled as he spoke the words,


"From a cow's tears
To a hobby of writing
Omit all his fears
To bring him a sighting

From a steer's eyes
To paper and a pen
Make him realize
What he knew back then!"
15.title: Spell Bound

choices: Harry, Ron, and Hermione refuse to leave
Harry, Ron and Hermione run out of the room
151.content:
Ron stumbled over his own feet trying to put distance between him and Professor Lockhart. Gilderoy was screaming as the memories of the basilisk returned. He waved his arms over his head, defending himself from his remembered fears.

Hermione grabbed Harry and Ron, dragging them from the path of the nurse who rushed in to find the source of the noise. Her eyes widened as she saw Gilderoy gyrating in his floating chair, waving his hands at nothing.

She turned to the children, "Shoo, you've upset him. Go on now, you've caused enough trouble for one day."
151.title: Remembered Fears

info.brief_description: Help the cast of HP restore some memories to Professor Lockhart.
info.description:
This little Harry Potter interactive starts towards the end of “Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets” where the ever-popular Professor Gilderoy Lockhart goes from gardener of minds to a mental vegetable. Harry Potter, Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley, especially Ron, feel somewhat responsible for Professor Lockhart being sent to St. Mungo’s hospital and make attempts to visit him.

These are more than friendly visits to their fallen teacher, they go to St. Mungo’s to help restore Gilderoy back to at least half the man that he was before Ron’s wand erased his memory along with his self respect…

In the course of the telling of this story I ask you to stay, as close as you can, to the characters, places and things in the real Harry Potter series. This interactive wasn’t created to question your knowledge of Harry Potter, so sit back and have fun.
